description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Neal Adams.
  2. "Get Out of My Life, Superman!" (part 1) "Love Comes to Lois Lorne!" (part 2) "The Jealous Superman!" (part 3) written by Leo Dorfman, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger. The story continues in the next issue.

Note how Lois rips out "Girl Friend" from the title on the cover, seemingly leaving a hole in it.

Lois Lane: Get out of my magazine, Superman! I'm leaving Metropolis to start a new life... one that doesn't include you!

"At last! The impossible comes true! It's... 'Splitsville for Lois and Superman!'"
name: Get Out of My Life, Superman!

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Murphy Anderson.
  2. "Superman Meets Super-Houdini!" written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Murphy Anderson.
  3. "The Day Superboy Became Superman!" written by Geoff Brown, penciled by Ross Andru and inked by Mike Esposito.
  4. "It's the Scene" gag strip by Henry Boltinoff.
name: Superman Meets Super-Houdini! / The Day Superboy Became Superman!

description: In this one-shot, Lois investigates some missing children in Canada.
name: Girl Frenzy

description:
Pulido cuts loose with an exciting new book set a few hundred years in the future at a special introductory price! Technology has failed man and there is a return to the medieval times, but with a twist. Instead the world is populated by all sorts of supernatural beings and monsters. Into this supernatural wasteland comes War Angel, a cold-hearted killer who shows little remorse or regard for life. Her past is unknown, but she has no conscious, a quick temper and a taste for mayhem. This special intro book features an all-new story where War Angel comes to Las Vegas, now renamed Sodom, and gets in between two warring supernatural gangs who deal the drug Grace. War Angel pits the gangs against each other, but in the end she may have to kill them all! Also, get an inside look at War Angel material not seen in the Pulido FCBD book including character designs, a cover gallery, an introduction by creator Brian Pulido, and more!

VariantCover ArtistltdRelease Date
regularWalter Geovani October 2004
Riot GirlWalter Geovani October 2004
wrapWalter Geovani October 2004
PlatinumWalter GeovaniincentiveOctober 2004

volume.name: Brian Pulido's War Angel: Book of Death

description:
Midas of Metropolis: Superman's hoarding money, but giving none of it away! What's gotten into him?

After stopping some thieves from robbing Cyrus Brand, one of the richest men in the world, Superman starts charging the people he rescues from disasters. Soon, he amasses so much money that he builds his own bank in which to store it. He goes into competition with Brand, trying to beat him out of every deal for making money. It emerges that Superman had detected that Brand was running a counterfeiting ring, and he had to acquire all of Brand's money to sort out the real cash from the bogus bills.

Requiem for a Hot Rod: As Clark and Lois are participating in a vintage car rally, they are forced off the road by "Coffin" Crowley, leader of a gang of speed racers. Determined to teach Crowley a lesson, Clark accuses him of being a phoney and gets challenged to a game of chicken. After Clark wins the game by forcing Crowley off the road, he reveals Crowley's secret: the hood ornament on his car reflected the sun's glare into his opponent's eyes, making him swerve off the road.
name: Midas of Metropolis

description:
Phase-crucifixions! Astral squid-beasts! Conniving aristocrats! Tangled in all the obstacles and oddities of an exotic Empire, the Silver Surfer finds that his toughest test- to soothe the hatred of ancient enemies- is beyond even the Power Cosmic. But is he prepared to commit the ultimate atrocity to secure a chance for peace? Cosmic craziness turns to darkness and death, as Spurrier and Huat's galactic extravaganza takes an unexpected turn with the surprise appearance of a looming figure from the Surfer's past.

The Silver Surfer is found crucified on the planet Brekknis. The Brekk, who believe the Surfer to be their savior, manage to get his down. This is the last straw for the Brekk, and they are ready to start a war with the Ama. The Surfer says that no war should be started in his name and leaves. The experience aboard the Organpirates craft gives the Surfer the idea to ttravel to the astral plane.

It is here he mets a cosmic entity and it immediately attacks him. He settles the creature down and they begin to speak. Taking the form of the Surfer's beloved Shalla Bal, the creature tells him that the Ama have kidnaped it's offspring (the creature who the Surfer has fought twice) and plan to use the Surfer to start a war with the Brekk, which is already beginning. The Surfer agrees to help the being gets it's child back but has a favor to ask.

The Surfer barges into the quarters of the Empress. She tells the Surfer the secret, bloddy history of the Brekk and that they must be destroyed. Just then, Tol-Wes in his battle armor smashes into the chamber. The Surfer stops them from killing one another and gives them an ultimatum. The first planet to attack the other will be destroyed by the planet eater, Galactus (who is an illusion created by the cosmic being).
name: In Thy Name: Part 3

description:
1. Cover by Neal Adams.
  2. "You Can Take the Man Out of the Super, But You Can't Take the Super Out of the Boy!" (Superman) written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Tex Blaisdell. Lex Luthor has changed Superman, Batman, and the Flash into Superboy, Batboy, and Kid Flash!
  3. "Justice for All includes Children, 8" a public service ad.

Notes:

  • This issue contains the Hostess Superhero Ad, Batman and Robin in "The Muse".
name: You Can Take the Man Out of the Super, But You Can't Take the Super Out of the Boy!

description:
1. Cover by Curt Swan and Murphy Anderson.
  2. "The Hero Superman Doomed to Die!" written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Murphy Anderson.
  3. "The Shocking Secret of Super-X!" written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Murphy Anderson.
  4. "The Atom's Phantom Double!" reprinted from The Atom #9.

The Hero Superman Doomed to Die!

He's totally alone, this astronaut, stranded in the soundless star-studded black void! Hopelessly far away from home... he waits... and waits... and waits... yet the Man of Steel does not fly to his rescue! Why? All is revealed in the spell-binding saga of... "The Hero Superman Doomed To Die!"

The Shocking Secret of Super-X!

Yes, who else but the Action Ace himself could have performed such an astounding feat? X stands for the unknown -- and there was no other word to describe this nameless, faceless crusader -- whose brief appearance will always remain a mystery in the annals of Metropolis U.! "The Shocking Secret of Super-X!"

The Atom's Phantom Double!

He was born in the swirling matrix of a nuclear eruption -- a duplicate Ray Palmer and The Atom! He had a phantom-like life -- but preferred the real-life existence of Ray (Atom) Palmer! He would stop at nothing to turn the real man into the phantom -- and himself become the living, breathing human being! His powers were so incredible that there appeared to be no escape from... "The Atom's Phantom Double!"

NASA have lost an astronaut in space, so who better to go rescue the poor man than Superman? But... why is Superman returning empty-handed?
name: The Hero Superman Doomed to Die! / The Shocking Secret of Super-X!

description:
1. Cover by Nick Cardy.
  2. "Who Is Clark Kent's Killer -- and Why is He Doing Those Terrible Things to Me?" written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Murphy Anderson.
  3. "The Secret Olympic Heroes" (part 1) "A Tale from the Secret Files of the Teen Titans" reprinted from Teen Titans #4.
  4. "The Baffling Block of Metropolis" written by Cary Bates, penciled by George Tuska and inked by Murphy Anderson. "An Untold Tale of Superman". The origin of the Fortress of Solitude's metal entrance door.

description:
1. The Six Elements of Crime (Superman vs Lex Luthor / written by Edmond Hamilton) -- 2. Lois Lane's Royal Romance (Lois, Superman / written by William Woolfolk) -- 3. Santa Claus Was a Thin Man (factual article on Saint Nick) -- 4. Superman, Hotel Manager (Superman / written by Alvin Schwartz)

"You'll witness an amazing duel when arch-criminal Luthor wages a scientific war against the Man of Steel!"

description: From the Realm Beyond the Mist, the Warpigs mass, ready to invade the Modern World of Man. Azure, the Dark Elf, stands at the head of the army, poised to give the attack command! Tarot, Raven Hex, and their Mother, chained and helpless, can do nothing but watch in horror!
name: The Mists of Darkness (Part 3 of 4)

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
Mists of Darkness Part 4 of 4

A Werecat, a Skeleton Man, thousands of War-Thogs, five Dragon Witches, an army of Ghosts, three Black Rose Witches and one really blood thirsty Elf, all collide in the sword wielding dramatic conclusion of the story arc,"Mists of Darkness"! The fate of mankind and the world depends on one Witch!
name: The Mists of Darkness (Part 4 of 4)

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
1. Lois Lane Meets Annie Oakley (Superman, Lois Lane / written by Alvin Schwartz) -- 2. The Life of Superman (Superman vs Angles Aldin / written by Edmond Hamilton) -- 3. Jerry the Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. The 'Copter Comes of Age (full text article) -- 5. The Pied Piper Prankster (Superman vs Prankster / written by Edmond Hamilton)

"Greatest team in the world now at the Playhouse : Superman and Annie Oakley"

description:
"Ghouls Gone Wild/ Hawaiian Holiday!" Part 1 of 2

After receiving unexpected check from the IRS, Jon takes Tarot and her Family from cold Salem to sunny Hawaii. There, with ring in hand, he plans to pop the big question to Tarot! But what Jon thought was a protective paradise, soon turns into an Island of Terror!
name: Hawaiian Holiday: Ghouls Gone Wild - pt. 1 of 2

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: Jon plans to propose marriage to Tarot but before he can pop the question, the engagement ring is stolen by zombie hula dancers! Meanwhile Tarot and Raven Hex face a different set of Jaws from the Deep! Will Tarot accept Jon's proposal if he recovers the ring?
name: Hawaiian Holiday: Ghouls Gone Wild - pt. 2 of 2

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: "The Goblin Queen" Story and Art By Jim Balent The Goblins throw a party for Raven Hex and this year it's wild! While Raven finds herself in the most dangerous part of the Enchanted Realm, trying to save a love sick Goblin from certain death, Tarot is left behind and becomes the prime target of all Goblin mischief!
name: The Goblin Queen!!

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: A HALLOWEEN CROSSOVER! SUPER HEROES MEET THE SUPERNATURAL! Tarot Witch of the Black Rose #28 "Witches-n-Kittens" Part 1 of 2 Story and Art By Jim Balent Tarot meets the 3 Kittens as they return from Iraq, transporting a secret cargo, Saddam Hussein, thought the streets of Salem. When Saddam escapes, thanks to the interference of Latex Red, Magickal Mayhem and costumed chaos ensues! This 3K/Tarot crossover, teams up the supernatural with Super heroes!
name: Witches And Kittens - pt. 1 of 2

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: "Witches-n-Kittens" Part 2 of 2 Story and Art By Jim Balent This issue concludes the story arc of "Witches-n-Kittens" Tarot and the 3 Kittens battle Latex Red and her troop of Satanic School Girls of Doom for the custody of prisoner Saddam Hussein. It's Witches of Mass destruction for Salem this Halloween!
name: Witches And Kittens - pt. 2 of 2

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: Sure Goblin cats are cute and cuddly! But they have an ugly condition. Their hairballs are haunted! Join Tarot and Boo Cat as they battle all the spookys and ghoulies that spring forth from Tarot's familiar ...Pooka the Goblin Cat!
name: Haunted Hairball

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
Superstition

Tarot is confronted by a Witch's oldest enemy..."Superstition". Now she must battle all the falsehoods of Witchcraft to stop this vicious circle of lies. Issue 25 explores Tarot's identity as a Witch and makes a great jumping on point for new readers as well as another exciting read for her devoted fans!
name: Superstition

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
1. Cover by Nick Cardy.
  2. "Target of the Toymen!" (Superman) written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Murphy Anderson.
  3. "The Million Dollar Methuselah Contract" (Human Target) written by Len Wein, penciled and inked by Dick Giordano.

"Target of the Toymen"

Clark Kent is shooting a commercial at the airport when someone shrinks and steals a 707. The methods used are similar to the Toyman but Superman notes that it can not be the original villain. The new Toyman manages to escape by using exploding bubble gum animals, which forces Superman to protect the town below them.

Within a few days, the Toyman has also shrunk and stolen a nuclear submarine and a solar train with the intent to ransom the three items for $100 million. The news reports catch the attention of Winslow Schott, the original Toyman, who decides to return in order to defend his reputation.

The new Toyman’s next target is the world’s fastest car but Schott appears on the scene and foils his plan. Schott offers to join forces with his younger counterpart, which he accepts over the threat of death.

They steal a satellite rocket and return to the forest where the new Toyman has been hiding his stolen possessions, however, he turns on Schott, attempting to suffocate him with poisonous cotton candy.

Unbeknown to them, Superman was hiding aboard the rocket and shrunk right along with it. After returning to normal size, Superman quickly dispatches the new Toyman by dribbling him into unconsciousness and uses his heat vision to free Schott from the cotton candy. Superman reveals that Schott was in on the plan to take down the new Toyman from the beginning.

"The Million Dollar Methuselah Contract"

Millionaire oilman Henderson Repp is riding his motorcycle through his oil fields when someone tries to take him out with a bazooka. Of course, Repp had hired the Human Target to take his place and he plays dead in order to trick the unknown assassin into believing that he had succeeded. Lying in the sand, Christopher Chance recalls how he had gotten to this point.

While skydiving, an attractive messenger catches up to him and passes along that Repp wants a meeting. Once on the ground, Repp hires Chance and says he suspects his nephew is trying to kill him.

Back in the present, the attractive messenger, Repp’s secretary Deedee, arrives on the scene to get Chance to safety and visit an oil well to congratulate the workers as Repp would.

That night, Chance finds Deedee has been kidnapped with the intent to lure out Repp as a tape recorder captures the whole incident. Deedee is being held captive at the same well seen earlier as Chance heads to the scene still disguised as Repp.

The hired gun appears to shoot him, only to see that it was dummy riding the motorcycle. Chance dodges a few bullets and shoots the rifle out of the gunmen’s hand. As Chance begins to climb the tower, the shooter threatens to explode a grenade and kill all of them unless Chance surrenders his weapon. Chance lowers his gun and fires a shot that dislodges the cap off the well.

With the cap loosened, the oil spews out from the ground and knocks the gunmen off the tower as the grenade explodes with Chance shielding Deedee from the blast. The next day, Chance tells Repp he should be safe now as the hired gun had given the police enough information to go after Repp’s nephew.
name: Target of the Toymen! / The Million Dollar Methuselah Contract

description:
The new world that has been created by Spawn begins in this issue. It seems as if the world is more than perfect, but the cracks are starting to appear, as the new world begins to show its true colors.

Spawn moves into the apartment building from Hell. For someone who has faced off against Overtkill, The Redeemer, Urizen, Cy-Gor and Malebolgia, an infestation of cockroaches should be no problem. But these are cockroaches with a difference. One of Spawn's greatest enemy's returns and in the end our last best defense may be an old lady and her roach spray.
name: The Voice-Hearers - Part 1: Skin Deep

description: It's the Spring Equinox and everything is awakening from the long winter sleep. Unfortunately that includes pesky pixies. One of whom steals the Black Rose birthmark right off Tarot's back! Joins us for Tarot's 5th year anniversary as she battles her way through the fairy realm to regain her birthmark. Makes a great jumping on point for new readers as well as another exciting read for her devoted fans!
name: Pesky Pixies

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: As a sinister shadow envelopes our Salem Heroes, Tarot, Raven Hex, and then Skeleton Man find themselves under the Spell of an old enemy. An arena of warring Witches, a deadly affliction and a new cemetery guardian, reveal themselves in this first chapter entitled, "The Gathering".
name: The Shadow Witch - pt. 1 of 4

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: New Avalon is in flames as Raven Hex and the Dragon Witch battle to the Death. Tarot under goes surgery and the Skeleton Man faces off against a new cemetery guardian as he battles to save his graveyard and the souls in it.
name: The Shadow Witch - pt. 2 of 4

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: Suffering severe wounds from their enemies, Tarot, Raven Hex, and the Skeleton Man face a long road of painful recovery. As their lives take a twisted path, The Shadow Witch takes diabolical pleasure in their torment! Boo Cat Becomes Tarot's naughty little nurse, Jon's caretakers heal him though an amusing sequence of 'interesting life memories'! And Mudwart stays by the side of his beloved Queen of the Goblins.
name: The Shadow Witch - pt. 3 of 4

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: Tarot, with revenge in her heart, sets off to kill the one who brought pain into the life of her and her loved ones, Azure the Dark Elf. But one Question haunts her, is she fulfilling the three fold law or is it murder!?
name: The Shadow Witch - pt. 4 of 4

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: The Skeleton Man, surrounded by the slowly decaying souls of the lost, descends into the puke filled depths of the underworld to rescue his ex-girlfriend, Crypt Chick. Tarot, tortured by her actions, seeks guidance from an old friend. But his comforting words are few.
name: REMAINS - To Be Seen

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: How would the future of their world change if Tarot had her way... if Raven Hex had her way...if the Dragon Witch had her way? Find out in this issue as we look into a crystal ball and reveal the fates of our heroes. Future Nightmares or Future Bliss?
name: Future Fates

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: "The Lovers' Card" In this issue Tarot is torn between two Lovers, Boo Cat and the Skeleton Man. Internal pressures force her to choose between them. Also, the return of the vampire Licorice Dust. Find out what dark place she has been lurking in for the past year.
name: The Lover's Card

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
Celebrate BroadSword Comics' 6th Year Anniversary with the telling of " Between Two Worlds". Tarot reveals the mysterious double life that all Witches must secretly lead. Plus a Bonus mini story featuring the first appearance of Jim Balent's new character the lovable hexy Witch "Spellarella"! As always this Issue ships to stores equally with 2 Jim Balent covers.

This issue includes a backup story: "Turbulence", starring Spellarella
name: Between Two Worlds

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: Expecting to meet with Tarot, Jon makes a visit to Witch Manor only to find that she's been called away to confront the revenge hungry Dragon Witches. What he does find is a broken Raven Hex in need. Playing nursemaid to the Dark Witch was the last thing Jon expected!
name: No Rest For The Witchy!!

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
The Great Coalition, an army formed of the warriors from the countries of the West have fought the Aiel Hordes for three days since they crossed the Spine of the World from the Aiel Waste and are exhausted. The massed Aiel keep coming and begin to close on Tar Valon the home of the Aes Sedai; female wielders of the One Power whose influence affects all the nations of the world. 
Meanwhile, within Tar Valon a Fortelling of great importance and yet potential doom is overheard by two young Accepted. The Dragon has been reborn!
name: Untitled

volume.name: Robert Jordan's The Wheel of Time: New Spring

description:
Who wants to be a millionaire? Porky! But Daffy won't let him! Also, Bugs phones in his performance as Elmer fumes; and Yosemite Sam meets the Three Bears!

  1. Reach Out and Bug Someone (Bugs Bunny, Elmer Fudd)
  2. So You Want A Million Bucks, Eh? (Daffy Duck, Porky Pig)
  3. Goldyrobber and the Three Bears (Yosemite Sam)
  4. Danger Line (Wile E. Coyote & Roadrunner)
  5. Remote Rage (Sylvester, Tweety, Granny)
name: At Wast I've Got You, You Wascal...

description:
Coyote's building a pyramid to trap the Roadrunner! Plus, Bugs defends Earth's carrot crop from Marvin the Martian.

  1. Cheops Stix (Wile E. Coyote and Roadrunner)
  2. A Cupid for Stupid and Stupid (Bugs Bunny)
  3. Carrot Conquest (Bugs Bunny, Marvin the Martian, K-9)
name: Cheops Stix

description: 1. The Devil May Care (Pepe le Pew, Taz, Penelope Pussycat) -- 2. Spelunk Heads (Yosemite Sam) -- 3. Midnight Smack (Sylvester, Tweety) -- 4. T.S.I. Toon Scene Investigators (Roadrunner, Wile E. Coyote, Daffy Duck, Porky Pig, Elmer Fudd, Bugs Bunny)
name: The Devil May Care

description:
1. Cover by Bob Oksner.
  2. "Superman, I'm Going to Re-Run Your Life!" (Superman) written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Tex Blaisdell. Superman vs. Purple Pile Driver, guest starring the Flash and Batman, with Melba Manton, with a flashback of Bruce's Wayne's parents and killer.
  3. "Daily Planet" Volume 76 Issue 13 the week of July 26, 1976 edited by Bob Rozakis and lettered by Typeset. Featuring is Gabe Kotter giving up a teaching career?
  4. "See Metropolis With Clark Kent" A (The Private Life of Clark Kent) story written by E. Nelson Bridwell, penciled and inked by Kurt Schaffenberger.

Notes:

  • This issue contains the Hostess Superhero Ad, Aquaman and Mera in "Twinkies and Kelp".
  • Batman parents being shot and the Barry Allen's laboratory being struck by lightning shown as a cameo flashback.
  • Batman and Flash characters are actually androids in this story.
name: Superman, I'm Going to Re-Run Your Life! / See Metropolis With Clark Kent

description:
1. Cover by Neal Adams.
  2. "The Tragic Fate of the Superman Sweethearts!" (part 1) "Death is the Wedding Guest!" (part 2) written by Leo Dorfman, penciled by Irv Novick and inked by Mike Esposito. Lois Lane goes into the far future.

"And this memorial symbolizes the great love between Superman and Lois Lane. They were killed on their honeymoon centuries ago, in 1968!"

Lois Lane (thought): That's my face!! I'm destined to marry Superman-- but we're both doomed!
name: The Tragic Fate of the Superman Sweethearts!

description:
Lured into helping an alien race, Superman, Batman and Robin must show them how to survive!

  1. The Super-Foes From Planet X (Superman, Batman and Robin / written by Edmond Hamilton)
  2. Know Your Pet! (public service message / written by Jack Schiff)
  3. Varsity Vic (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  4. Tomahawk's Pony Partner (Tomahawk / written by Dave Wood)
  5. Peg (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  6. Hitting the Starry Trail (full text article)
  7. Five Clues To Danger (Green Arrow / penciled and inked by Jack and Roz Kirby)

Batman: We're trapped in some strange force--and even Superman can't break out of it!
name: The Super-Foes From Planet X!

description:
1. Clark Kent's Super-Masquerade (Superman vs R24 / written by Bill Finger) -- 2. The Anti-Superman Club (Superman / written by Edmond Hamilton) -- 3. Jerry Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. Minus Three Ninety (full text article) -- 5. The Man Who Stole the Oceans (Superman vs Lex Luthor / written by Edmond Hamilton)

"Charity Bazaar : Kiss the Man of Steel for $1"

Superman: Why should anybody want to kiss me? I'm nobody important!
name: Clark Kent's Super-Masquerade

description:
1. The Unfunny Prankster (Superman vs Prankster, Financier / written by Alvin Schwartz) -- 2. The Private Life of Perry White (Perry White, Alice White, Will White, Superboy (flashback) / written by Edmond Hamilton) -- 3. The Man Who Knew All the Words (full text bio of Noah Webster / written by R. Fairbanks) -- 4. The Flight of the Failures (Superman, Manton / written by Bill Woolfolk)

"What can Superman do when Clark Kent becomes a failure? Read about the strangest space voyage of all time-"

"Who cares if we're lost? No one will miss us. We're a shipful of failures!"
name: The Flight of the Failures

description:
1. Hank Garvin, Man of Steel (Superman / written by Bill Finger)-- 2. The Mighty Mite (Superman, Ma and Pa Kent (flashback), Super Baby (flashback) / written by Bill Finger) -- 3. Jerry Jitterbug (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff) -- 4. Boxing's Forgotten Man (full text article by Frank Minton) -- 5. Perry White Vs. Clark Kent (Perry White, Superman, Maxwell Leeds)

Superman: No need for me to save him! He's as powerful as I am!
name: Hank Garvin, Man of Steel

description:
1. Act Your Age! (public service message by Binky / written by Jack Schiff)
  2. The Case of the Crying Clown! (Superboy / written by William Woolfolk)
  3. Little Pete (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  4. The Pet from Outer Space! (Superboy, Lana Lang / written by William Woolfolk)
  5. Roundies (puzzle page by Martin Naydel)
  6. The Most Amazing Toys in the World (full text article by Bob Winslow)
  7. Legend of the Lamplighter (full text article)
  8. Shorty (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)
  9. The Crazy Costumes! (Superboy, Lana / written by William Woolfolk)
  10. Club Emblem (Superboy's Workshop)
name: The Crazy Costumes of the Boy of Steel!

description: 1. The Defense of Fort Columbia (Cerebus, Scott, Bo) -- 2. The First Invention of Armor 1404 (Cerebus, Hagbad Spleen, Bear) -- 3. Squinteye the Sailor (Cerebus, Squinteye, Bluto) -- 4. Cerebus vs the Spirit (Cerebus, Dolan, The Octopus, The Spirit, Will Eisner)

The Skeleton man's visit to the Big Apple is anything but CATatonic when recruited by the 3 Little Kittens to help take down a demented terrorist group armed with a dirty bomb! Visions of this CATaclysmic event has Tarot racing to the city! As always this Issue ships equally to stores with 2 Jim Balent covers.
name: Hex In The City

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: Where do dreams go when they die? Tarot is caught in a dead dream realm where she is surrounded by twisted visions of unfulfilled desires. Meanwhile the Skeleton Man gets unexpected visitors from another cemetery and comes face to face with a real Skeleton Man!
name: Dead Leaves

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description: Being a Witch means you are a keeper of ancient knowledge. Knowledge to heal, knowledge to kill, knowledge of great power. Holders of such power become a target for those who would enslave that power. This is part one of a multi-part story arc! As always this Issue ships equally to stores with 2 Jim Balent covers.
name: The Witch Key, Part 1

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
Imprisoned in a detention camp for Witches by a power hunger tyrant, Tarot is faced with a choice of either revealing the secrets of her Magick or Death!

This is Part 2 of a multi-part Story Arc.
name: The Witch Key, Part 2

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
"The Witch Key" part 3

Left to die under the ice of a frozen lake, Tarot's thoughts of saving her Witch Sisters from the prison temple is the only thing keeping her struggling for life. But can she first save herself from a dark,cold watery grave?
name: The Witch Key, Part 3

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
The secret of the Witch Key is revealed as Tarot with her newly freed band of Witches confront the Bleeding Man and his minions. Unlock the climax to the 'Witch Key' story arc in this final chapter titled, "Blood and Magick".

This is Part 4 of a multi-part Story Arc.

This was a unique issue because of the 47 fangirls that were cast as witches in this part of the storyline. Balent does an excellent job of rendering fan pics into a cohesive set of panels to move the plot along. The vast majority of this issue was given over to the epic battle scene and much of the narrative was descriptive of the particular witches, such as "A spazzy witch, being attacked from all sides, uses her chaotic majick on multiple targets around her." It also marked the end of the “Witch Key” storyline in which Tarot and her witch sisters fight the Bleeding Man.
name: The Witch Key, Part 4

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
In May of 1962, Astonishman destroyed the world. Acting on information from Charles Lexington, he attacked a vessel on the bottom of the ocean with a nuclear missile. It was not a nuclear facility but was ,in fact, an alien vessel that had been giving aid to the world. When the warhead went off it detonated a chain reaction in the vessels engines. The resulting explosion caused the Earth to be knocked off it's axis and shredded the magnetosphere allowing the world to be bombarded by cosmic radiation. This became known as the Green Event. Three billion people were killed. Of the survivors, one in ten thousand would gain superhuman powers.

Astonishman formed The Squadron of Righteousness and attempted to fight the forces of evil. Year after year, they fought until Dead Lexington gathered the villains and in one massive, coordinated attack, wiped out most of the world's heroes. This day became known as the Day of Annihilation. Astonishman gathered survivors and hid them in his Citadel of Seclusion. Fighting for survival and trying to find Thor's hammer, Mjolnir, this rag-tag group

is named The End League.

Twelve years later, the members of the group are starving. They plan an attack on one of Dead Lexington's food facilities run by Scarecrow Sinister in northern Canada. Astonishman chooses Soldier American, Brother Occult, Divinity, The Prairie Ghost, and Blur to join him for the attack.

Jackie finds people all around are out to get him. At least he has a new "girlfriend," sort of.

Overview

Following the stunning events of the spectacular first issue, writer Phil Hester (Superman: Confidential, Green Arrow) and new talent Michael Broussard (Unholy Union) introduce the sensual and mysterious Eve into the world of The Darkness! And as Jackie takes on the rebels he finds there may be more to them than meets the eye. Will Jackie's time in paradise be short lived?
name: Empire, Part Two: Eve

description:
Sorcery surrounds the yuletide festivities as playful events turn into something unepected.Also, just intime for the holiday season, the cute and petite witch, Spellarella returns with her own snowy adventure.

This issue includes a second story: "Twas The Night Of Yule", starring Spellarella!
name: Holiday Witches

volume.name: Tarot: Witch of the Black Rose

description:
Story by Paul Dini; Story consultant Keith Giffen; Scripts by Tony Bedard; Art by Pete Woods and Tom Derenick; Covers by Woods

It's all-out war as the Challengers find Ray Palmer - and so does everyone else! The fate of a universe hangs in the balance, as heroes and villains from across the multiverse face betrayal and death with Earth as their battlefield!

Plus, more DC Villains origin backup stories, including The Origin of Gorilla Grodd by Scott Beatty and Arthur Adams!
name: Choke On It!

description:
As Darkness-bearer Jackie Estacado takes control of Mafia Family affairs, his first order of business is to clean up the deadwood...and that pretty much describes Ernie Palanco. Ernie has wanted to be a mobster since the day he was born. But what happens when you can't aim a gun, you can't keep hold of the bosses' money, and you keep shooting the wrong people by accident? The blackest of black humor is brought to you in this special stand-alone issue by Paul Jenkins (Spectacular Spider-Man) and Eric Basaldua (The Magdalena).                    

SPOILERS

Jackie Estacado is now in control of the Mafia Family affairs, but that won't be easy task as a rival turf is training to gain some territory.
name: In Search of the Blue Goldfish (Part 1):

description:
1. Cover by Bob Oksner.
  2. "Die Now, Live Later!" (Superman) written by Cary Bates, penciled by Curt Swan and inked by Tex Blaisdell. Clark Kent is a newspaper reporter, but his boss is Ben Franklin?!? Can he remember who he really is, or will he be stuck in Colonial times, just as Karb-Brak planned?
  3. "Justice for All Includes Children, 6" public service ad.

Notes:

  • This story takes place on July 4th 1776.
name: Die Now, Live Later!

description:
1. The Lost Secrets of Krypton (Superman vs Lex Luthor, with Lois Lane; retells Superman's origin story with Jor-El, Lara, Martha and Jonathan Kent / written by Edmond Hamilton)
  2. Superman's Masters (Superman / written by Alvin Schwartz)
  3. Super Ships (full text article by David King)
  4. The Secret of Superman's Home (Superman vs Hatchet Kaims / written by Edmond Hamilton)

Lex Luthor: Ha-ha, Superman! I'm using the very same ray invented by your own father, Jor-El, to turn you and Miss Lane into stone!
name: The Lost Secrets of Krypton

description: Marrow takes center stage! Separated from her former teammates and re-forming a new Gene Nation, will Marrow finally be free from the ghosts of her past? Or will they come back to haunt her?
name: Gene Nation Rising

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description:
1. The Prankster's Star Pupil (Superman vs Prankster / written by Edmond Hamilton) -- 2. Superman--Thrill Salesman (Superman vs Jansson / written by Edmond Hamilton) -- 3. So You Want To Be a G-Man? (full text article) -- 4. The Man Who Stole Memories (Superman, Lois Lane / written by Bill Woolfolk)

Superman: But-but Lois, don't you remember me? I'm Superman!

Lois Lane: You needn't bother showing off your muscles for my benefit, mister! I'm not impressed!

"It's a job for Superman when Lois Lane becomes a victim of... 'The Man Who Stole Memories!'"
name: The Man Who Stole Memories

description: Agent Zero makes his final stand against the former Weapon X agent known as Maverick. Plus, Chamber and Wolverine take one step closer to discovering the horrifying truth about Neverland!
name: Under the Mask

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: Agent Zero takes on Gene Nation… and this time, it's personal!
name: Countdown to Zero

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: The new WEAPON X series begins in this all-new one-shot!
name: Initiation

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

volume.name: Weapon X: The Draft - Agent Zero

description: The new WEAPON X series begins in this all-new one-shot!
name: Caught In The Draft

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: The new WEAPON X series begins in this all-new one-shot!
name: Septic Beauty

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: The new WEAPON X series begins in this all-new one-shot!
name: Falling to Pieces

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: The new WEAPON X series begins in this all-new one-shot! The enigmatic organization known as Weapon X is on the hunt to draft new members! Who will draw their attention and how much will they be willing to sacrifice in order to have their lives changed forever? This is the first of five one-shots that lead into WEAPON X, the monthly series that launches next month!
name: Shock the Monkey

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

volume.name: Weapon X: The Draft - Wild Child

description:
1. The Man Who Went To Krypton (Superman, Professor Enders : origin story with Jor-El and Lara / written by Bill Finger) -- 2. The Greatest Pitcher In the World (Superman vs The Professor, The Fixer / written by Bill Finger) -- 3. Greatest Showman In the World (full text P.T. Barnum bio) -- 4. Superman Meets Pocahontas (Superman, Pocahontas / written by William Woolfolk) -- 5. Professor Eureka (gag strip by Henry Boltinoff)

Superman: But--but how can this be? I was positive nobody from Earth had ever been to my native planet before it exploded!

Picture: Jor-El with his wife and baby (now Superman), and I, Prof. Enders, on Krypton.
name: The Man Who Went to Krypton

description: It's Christmas in the DCU, and Alan Scott will be learning all about the Ho-Ho-Horror of the holidays from the immortal Vandal Savage! But in order to save the life of a child, Alan will have to sacrifice his own happiness - as well as his daughter!
name: Ghosts of Christmas Past

description:
1. Cover by Neal Adams.
  2. "Witch on Wheels!" (part 1) "The Super-Cyclist!" (part 2) written by Frank Robbins, penciled by Irv Novick and inked by Mike Esposito.

Superman (thought): What have I done? I've forced Lois to ride with a cycle gang. And I've made Clark Kent quit his "chicken" pose!
name: Witch on Wheels!

description: 'CREATE THE FUTURE, DESTROY THE PAST' From the mind of comic book innovator JONATHAN HICKMAN, comes the exhilarating time-traveling epic, PAX ROMANA. The creator of THE NIGHTLY NEWS brings his unique sensibility to science fiction and the result is a visually stunning look at a new history of the world. PAX ROMANA tells the tale of 5000 men sent on an impossible mission to change the past and save the future. It's the end of the world: Will they succeed, or will they fail?
name: Destroy The Past. Create The Future.

description: In the jungles of Venezuela, a research team discovers a strange life form. Meanwhile, in the Big Apple, Casey, Raph and Don get the abandoned armored car running, much to the dismay of the local New Yorkers. Master Splinter and Shadow are enraptured by the television coverage of an invasion of Unidentified Flying Objects.
